sentence.Network_en: He sacrificed his own career so that his avaricious brother could succeed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他牺牲了自己的事业，这样他贪婪的弟弟才能成功。

sentence.Network_en: I call on your own memory as witness: remember we have avaricious hearts.
sentence.Network_cn: 假使你想要保证和证明,你可以回忆一下我们贪婪的心.

sentence.Network_en: The gentleman is also avaricious, much less pass student.
sentence.Network_cn: 君子还爱财呢, 何况普通学生.

list.abs: Say in demon when hind , second had avaricious idea suddenly ., 在精灵说完的时后 , 乙忽然起了贪心的念头.
she is an avaricious person and seldom helps others .她是个贪婪的人，很少帮助别人。
avaricious algorithm is to pass series of the solution that the choice will come to to get a problem .贪心算法是通过一系列的选择来得到一个问题的解。
to an avaricious father , a prodigal son .有吝啬的父亲必有败家的儿子。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French avaricieux, based on Latin avarus 'greedy'

entry.tran: 贪财的;贪婪的;贪得无厌的
entry.def: An avaricious person is very greedy for money or possessions.

example.ex: He sacrificed his own career so that his avaricious brother could succeed.
example.tran: 他牺牲了自己的事业，这样他贪婪的弟弟才能成功。

means.word_mean: 1. immoderately desirous of acquiring e.g. wealth;

sentences.sentence: "they are avaricious and will do anything for money"
"casting covetous eyes on his neighbor's fields"
"prehensile employers stingy with raises for their employees"

auth_sentence.content: The profits of trade are baits to the avaricious shopkeeper.
auth_sentence.res_content: The profits of trade are baits to the avaricious shopkeeper.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The profits of trade are baits to the avaricious shopkeeper.

auth_sentence.content: He saw his people...avaricious, arrogant, unjust.
auth_sentence.res_content: He saw his people...avaricious, arrogant, unjust.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He saw his people...avaricious, arrogant, unjust.

auth_sentence.content: For those who defy the avaricious BBC, the threats are constant.
auth_sentence.res_content: For those who defy the avaricious BBC, the threats are constant.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For those who defy the avaricious BBC, the threats are constant.

stems_affixes.word_buile: avarice[n.贪财,贪婪]+ous……的→adj.贪财的, 贪婪的
avar渴望,鸟+ice状态→渴望状态→贪心
